heading: This Afternoon
text: Snow and blowing snow far south, tapering off, with another 2 to 4 inches; up to an inch north to Route 4, and maybe a dusting father north. Highs in the mid to upper 20s. North to northeast winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 25 mph north, and to 35 mph in the south.

heading: Tonight
text: Chance of early snow showers along and east of the Connecticut Valley, then slight chance of snow showers overnight in the northern mountains. Lows in the teens south, and 5 to 10 above in the north, except around zero in the Adirondacks. North to northwest winds 5 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph east of the Greens.

heading: Tuesday
text: Partly to mostly sunny, except partly cloudy northeast, and in the mountains. Valley highs mainly in the upper teens to lower 20s, with some mid teens far north, and mid to upper 20s southeast. Winds from the northwest at 5 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph in New Hampshire, and decreasing in the afternoon.
